title: Heatwave to sweep south-east states, BOM delivers Christmas Day forecast | ABC NEWS
description: Temperatures are forecast to soar in the coming days for parts of South Australia, Victoria, and NSW in a big summer heatwave. The Bureau of Meteorology has delivered their outlook on the weather for Christmas Day across the the country, cautioning the forecast could shift in the week ahead. title: PM says government could have done more on antisemitism | ABC NEWS
description: The prime minister has been asked why he hasn't acted on antisemitism until the Bondi Beach terrorist attack at a press conference on Thursday where he was announcing tougher hate speech laws.  He says the government "could have always done more".  But when pressed on why he hasn't done more, Mr Albanese said he'd done his best to respond to the terrorist attack.  The prime minister also says the government "fully supports" and adopts antisemitism envoy Jillian Segal's report which was handed down in July.   He also says he would like Ms Segal to be a permanent feature of the landscape of this country.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Superannuation funds accused of delaying disability insurance claims | The Business | ABC  NEWS
description: Some superannuation members are still experiencing delays and issues with total and permanent disability (TPD) insurance claims through their super funds. Such delays can cause people severe financial hardship at among the worst times of their lives when they are facing a serious disability and/or mental health struggles. Consumer groups want super funds to respond to claims within specific timeframes, which the industry is opposed to. Assistant Treasurer Daniel Mulino says there have been some areas where some funds have fallen short and the government is consulting on new standards to improve how they engage with members. Nassim Khadem reports. #ABCBusiness  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-15/super-funds-accused-of-poor-handling-of-tpd-insurance-claims/106050046   ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. description: üìç In the lead up to the attack on a Hannukah celebration at Bondi, alleged terrorists Naveed and Sajid Akram are said by local staff to have stayed in a hotel room in Davao, Philippines for most of November. title: These women in 1975 didn't like women's liberation | ABC NEWS
description: 1975 was the International Year of the Woman, and the ABC asked Australian women for their opinions on the women's liberation movement. On this particular day, all the women the ABC interviewed weren't in favour of it.   By Megan Jacobson for ABC News Social Media team, using footage from the ABC archives. title: Four more victims farewelled as Bondi crime scene reopened to the public | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 *Warning: This video contains content some viewers might find confronting.* 00:05 The youngest Bondi victim, 10-year-old Matilda, has been farewelled by friends and family at a Sydney funeral. Holocaust survivor Alexander Kleytman, who died protecting his wife from bullets, was also laid to rest. 02:57 The crime scene at Bondi Beach has reopened to the public. Locals have been slowly returning to get their cars and belongings left behind as they tried to escape the terror. 05:00 The names, faces and stories of more victims have emerged. 06:32 A $20 million federal and state support package will provide the victims' families with financial aid and cover funeral costs. 07:01 A police operation involving the state Tactical Operations Unit has taken place in the Sydney suburb of Liverpool. Police can't say yet if there are any ties to the Bondi investigation. title: Man sentenced to life in mental health facility over ANU stabbing | ABC NEWS
description: The ACT Supreme Court has found the man who stabbed two students at the Australian National University in 2023 may never be safe to be released into the community. Alex Ophel was found not guilty of two counts of attempted murder by reason of mental impairment. The 26-year-old will remain in a secure mental health facility, potentially for the rest of his life. title: Information reward doubles to $500k for missing NT mother Angie Fuller | ABC NEWS
description: NT Police has doubled its reward for information related to the disappearance of Angie Fuller, almost three years on from her suspected murder in outback Australia.  The last confirmed sighting of the 30-year-old mother of two was at a petrol station on the outskirts of Alice Springs on January 9, 2023, and she was reported missing two days later.  Ms Fuller's disappearance sparked a large-scale police and emergency services search through rugged terrain in the Tanami Desert in Central Australia ‚Äî but despite those efforts, she was never located. title: Regional tensions simmer as Trump orders Venezuela oil blockade | ABC NEWS
description: Venezuela is vowing to continue its international oil trade, ordering naval ships to escort tankers a day after the White House declared a blockade. The order comes as the United States carried out another fatal strike on a boat in the Pacific it claims was trafficking drugs. title: Albanese announces tougher hate speech laws in wake of Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to clamp down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly Bondi terror attack, while conceding his government is not perfect and could have done more before the tragedy.   02:35 Political Lead David Speers takes a look at why the Prime Minister needed to shift gears on how he's been seen to handle events since Sunday's terror attack. title: Inside the Philippines hotel room staff say the Bondi gunmen stayed in | ABC NEWS
description: Alleged terrorists Naveed and Sajid Akram spent almost a month holed up in a small hotel room in a city in the southern Philippines in the lead-up to the attack, local staff have said.  Hotel staff showed the ABC through the room they say the father and son stayed in, which consisted of two single beds, a TV and a basic bathroom. title: Scientists work to save sea lions on Kangaroo Island I ABC NEWS
description: South Australia's harmful algal bloom is being partly blamed for a significant spike in Australian sea lion pup deaths. The state government says 84 dead pups were recently recorded on the Pages Islands. Scientists are working to bolster the resilience of the endangered species as the threat of bird flu also approaches. title: Indonesia welcomes repatriation of ancient human fossils | The World | ABC NEWS
description: A museum in The Netherlands has returned a set of ancient human fossils known as 'Java Man' to Indonesia, where the remains were originally found more than 100 years ago. The move is being celebrated by historians and advocates, who say the fossils were removed "against the will of the people" during Dutch rule in Indonesia. The World's Girish Sawlani spoke to Indira Estiyanti Nurjadin, Head of the Indonesian Heritage Agency, about the importance of the repatriation. title: Venezuela denounces Trump's order for ship blockade as 'warmongering threats' | The World | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump has ordered a blockade on sanctioned oil tankers entering and leaving Venezuela in what he's called a response to drug smuggling and human trafficking. The Venezuelan government has labelled the move as "warmongering threats". Brian Fonseca from the Department of Politics and International Relations at Florida International University, tells The World the US is capable of implementing a blockade of this magnitude.
